page.title: 01ROSSINGTON, SOUTH YORKSHIRE.
page.content: The region surveyed is 7/12 rural, 1/3 residential and 1/12 coal mining. It is a low lying area through which flows the River Torne, tributary of the River Trent. Rossington is a very large residential village with a population of 12,750 (1981). It is 6 miles south of the Metropolitan Borough of Doncaster of which it is part. The name Rossington derives from Rushington meaning marshy ground. In Roman times there was a fort and the Littleworth area was referred to in the Doomsday Book as Scitelfuuorde. Until 1912 the region was rural, the pit was then sunk and the village grew rapidly. The pit area is referred to as New Rossington ,though now some of the newest houses are in private estates in the original village centred around St Michael's church.
